heading: Monday Night
text: Partly cloudy early, then clouds increasing. Lows in the teens, some single digits northeast, rising late. Winds becoming light and variable, except becoming south 5 to 10 mph west of the Greens after midnight.

heading: Tuesday
text: Cloudy. Snow developing around sunrise in New York, then spreading north and east in the morning; daytime totals 5 to 9 inches south of Route 4, 3 to 7 inches between Route 4 and Route 2, and 2 to 5 inches from Route 2 northward, except 1 to 3 inches in the St. Lawrence and northern Champlain valleys. High temperatures from the mid 20s to around 30. Variable winds around 5 mph, becoming north late.

heading: Tuesday Night
text: Snow, mainly from Vermont eastward, and from Route 2 southward, all tapering off by midnight; another trace to 2 inches north, and 2 to 4 inches south, mainly southeast. Lows from the mid teens to mid 20s, north to south. Northeast winds 5 to 10 mph, becoming northwest and gusting to 25 mph.
